intro: Tanacetum johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, gray-green leaves and yellow flower heads that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its aromatic foliage and ornamental value make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
